body_html:
It's getting fused for me in script mode on master:

In [1]: import torch
   ...: @torch.jit.script
   ...: def constant_mul_add(x, y):
   ...:     return (2 * x + 3 + y) * 4
   ...:
   ...: x = torch.randn(10240, 1024)
   ...: y = torch.randn(10240, 1024)
   ...: constant_mul_add(x, y)
   ...: constant_mul_add.graph_for(x, y)
   ...:
   ...:
Out[1]:
graph(%x : Float(*, *)
      %y : Float(*, *)) {
  %11 : Float(*, *) = prim::FusionGroup_0[device=-1](%y, %x)
  return (%11);
}
with prim::FusionGroup_0 = graph(%4 : Float(*, *)
      %12 : Float(*, *)) {
  %11 : int = prim::Constant[value=2]()
  %13 : Float(*, *) = aten::mul(%11, %12)
  %8 : int = prim::Constant[value=3]()
  %9 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
  %10 : Float(*, *) = aten::add(%13, %8, %9)
  %5 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
  %6 : Float(*, *) = aten::add(%10, %4, %5)
  %1 : int = prim::Constant[value=4]()
  %2 : Float(*, *) = aten::mul(%6, %1)
  return (%2);
}

How are you running the code?

body:
It's getting fused for me in script mode on master:
```
In [1]: import torch
   ...: @torch.jit.script
   ...: def constant_mul_add(x, y):
   ...:     return (2 * x + 3 + y) * 4
   ...:
   ...: x = torch.randn(10240, 1024)
   ...: y = torch.randn(10240, 1024)
   ...: constant_mul_add(x, y)
   ...: constant_mul_add.graph_for(x, y)
   ...:
   ...:
Out[1]:
graph(%x : Float(*, *)
      %y : Float(*, *)) {
  %11 : Float(*, *) = prim::FusionGroup_0[device=-1](%y, %x)
  return (%11);
}
with prim::FusionGroup_0 = graph(%4 : Float(*, *)
      %12 : Float(*, *)) {
  %11 : int = prim::Constant[value=2]()
  %13 : Float(*, *) = aten::mul(%11, %12)
  %8 : int = prim::Constant[value=3]()
  %9 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
  %10 : Float(*, *) = aten::add(%13, %8, %9)
  %5 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
  %6 : Float(*, *) = aten::add(%10, %4, %5)
  %1 : int = prim::Constant[value=4]()
  %2 : Float(*, *) = aten::mul(%6, %1)
  return (%2);
}
```
How are you running the code?
